definition: to show sb how to get to the right path
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津

sentences.english: This hand torch, Helios flew before, please him.
sentences.chinese: 這才手執火把，飛到赫利俄斯面前，請他指點迷津。

sentences.english: Get back to work. There's a team in the office in need of your guidance.
sentences.chinese: 回去工作，辦公室裏還有個團隊等着你指點迷津呢。

sentences.english: They prayed to God for guidance.
sentences.chinese: 他們祈求上帝指點迷津。

sentences.english: Henceforth I will pray, but my cries for help will only be cries for guidance.
sentences.chinese: 從今往後，我要祈禱，但是我只求指點迷津。

sentences.english: Have you known someone who is always quick with a sharp word of condemnation?
sentences.chinese: 你是否見過一種人，他經常快言快語的愛指點迷津？

sentences.english: Failing that, let us be your guide.
sentences.chinese: 如果做不到這一點，讓我們來爲你指點迷津。

definition: to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to give instructions/to give advice
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
Yangdong county in Yangjiang 陽江|阳江[Yang2 jiang1], Guangdong
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
omniscient
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
Tiandihui (Chinese fraternal organization)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
young and promising
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
